info.title: Product Image
info.description:
Products are easier to sell if customers can see pictures of them, which is why there are product images.

{{ '/api/reference/product-image.png' | image }}

Any product may have up to 250 images, and images can be in .png, .gif or .jpg format.

Best practices for naming image files

To successfully upload or update images, follow these best practices when naming your image files:

  • Don't use spaces in the file name. Example: my file name.png
  • Don't begin your file name with symbols, like "!". Example: !my_file_name.png
  • Avoid using periods before the file extension. Example: my_file_name..png
  • Avoid long, complicated file names that contain excess characters.

    Example: my_---_file_---_name_---.png

paths.summary: Receive a list of all Product Images

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID

200.description: Receive a list of all Product Images

x-examples.name: Get all product images for a product

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/images.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Image.all(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: 632910392,
)

x-examples.name: Get all product images for a product after a specified ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/images.json?since_id=850703190" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Image.all(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: 632910392,
  since_id: "850703190",
)

x-examples.name: Create a new product image using a source URL that will be downloaded by Shopify

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"image":{"src":"http://example.com/rails_logo.gif"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/images.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

image = ShopifyAPI::Image.new(session: test_session)
image.product_id = 632910392
image.src = "http://example.com/rails_logo.gif"
image.save!

paths.description: Get a count of all product images
paths.summary: Receive a count of all Product Images

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID

200.description: Receive a count of all Product Images

x-examples.name: Get a count all product images

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/images/count.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Image.count(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: 632910392,
)

x-examples.name: Get a count of all product images after a specified ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/images/count.json?since_id=850703190" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Image.count(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: 632910392,
  since_id: "850703190",
)

paths.description: Get a single product image by id

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/images/850703190.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Image.find(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: 632910392,
  id: 850703190,
)

x-examples.name: Modify an image and change its position and alt tag content

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"image":{"id":850703190,"position":2,"alt":"new alt tag content"}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/images/850703190.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

image = ShopifyAPI::Image.new(session: test_session)
image.product_id = 632910392
image.id = 850703190
image.position = 2
image.alt = "new alt tag content"
image.save!

x-examples.name: Modify an image; add a metafield

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"image":{"id":850703190,"metafields":[{"key":"my_new_metafield","value":"my_new_value","type":"single_line_text_field","namespace":"tags"}]}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/images/850703190.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

image = ShopifyAPI::Image.new(session: test_session)
image.product_id = 632910392
image.id = 850703190
image.metafields = [
  {
    "key" => "my_new_metafield",
    "value" => "my_new_value",
    "type" => "single_line_text_field",
    "namespace" => "tags"
  }
]
image.save!

x-examples.name: Modify an image; add it to product variants

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"image":{"id":850703190,"variant_ids":[808950810,457924702]}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/images/850703190.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

image = ShopifyAPI::Image.new(session: test_session)
image.product_id = 632910392
image.id = 850703190
image.variant_ids = [
  808950810,
  457924702
]
image.save!

curl -X DELETE "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/images/850703190.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Image.delete(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: 632910392,
  id: 850703190,
)

properties.description: The date and time when the product image was created. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format.
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: A unique numeric identifier for the product image.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The order of the product image in the list. The first product image is at position 1 and is the "main" image for the product.
properties.name: position

properties.description: The id of the product associated with the image.
properties.name: product_id

properties.description: An array of variant ids associated with the image.
properties.name: variant_ids

properties.description: Specifies the location of the product image. This parameter supports Liquid filters that you can use to retrieve modified copies of the image.
properties.name: src

properties.description: Width dimension of the image which is determined on upload.
properties.name: width

properties.description: Height dimension of the image which is determined on upload.
properties.name: height

properties.description: The date and time when the product image was last modified. The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format.
properties.name: updated_at

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Add or update a store's product images, which sales channels use to display the products to shoppers.
